intro: Silene otodonta, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene otodonta is often found in sandy or clay soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
